meanings.definition: A type of palm tree native to Africa and the Middle East.
meanings.sent1: The doum tree provides shade in the hot desert.
meanings.sent2: I saw a doum tree while on safari in Africa.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys played in the branches of the doum tree.
meanings.sent4: The doum tree stood tall like a guardian of the desert.
meanings.sent5: The doum tree's leaves rustled in the wind, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with great force.
meanings.sent1: He doumed the ball with all his might, sending it flying.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith doumed the metal to shape it.
meanings.sent3: She doumed the door closed in frustration.
meanings.sent4: The storm doumed the coast, causing destruction.
meanings.sent5: The boxer doumed his opponent with a powerful punch.

meanings.sent1: The doum of the thunder echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The doum of the drum reverberated in the room.
meanings.sent3: The doum of the gong startled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The doum of the bass guitar added depth to the music.
meanings.sent5: The doum of the cannon signaled the start of the battle.
